description: From Irish cáibín, from cába (“cape”), from cappa (“cape”)

entries.meaning: (fashion) An Irish beret, formerly worn by peasants, later also adopted for army use.
examples: […]  a bare-legged Celtic brother of the gentle craft, somewhat at the wrong side of forty, with a turf-coloured caubeen, patched frieze, a clear brown complexion, dark-grey eyes, and a right pleasant dash of roguery in his features  […]
